<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Construct a unary instruction, given the opcode and an operand.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Optionally (if InstBefore is specified) insert the instruction</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// into a BasicBlock right before the specified instruction.  The specified</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Instruction is allowed to be a dereferenced end iterator.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unaryoperator/#a301854f13228be009fe2a6af14f05484">UnaryOperator</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/unaryoperator/#a2200cefdf51f62605459b2f2cdfccfa1">Create</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#af9f57a32b08304fea642871735717f24">UnaryOps</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;S,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal">                               </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;Name = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a>(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">                               <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/insertposition">InsertPosition</a> InsertBefore = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These methods just forward to Create, and are useful when you</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// statically know what type of instruction you&#39;re going to create.  These</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// helpers just save some typing.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125" lineLink="#a27e1be526590c342b05ad73c05f6455b"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define HANDLE&#95;UNARY&#95;INST(N, OPC, CLASS)                                       \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  static UnaryOperator &#42;Create##OPC(Value &#42;V, const Twine &amp;Name = &quot;&quot;) &#123;        \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    return Create(Instruction::OPC, V, Name);                                  \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &quot;llvm/IR/Instruction.def&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#define HANDLE&#95;UNARY&#95;INST(N, OPC, CLASS)                                       \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  static UnaryOperator &#42;Create##OPC(Value &#42;V, const Twine &amp;Name,               \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">                                    InsertPosition InsertBefore = nullptr) &#123;   \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">    return Create(Instruction::OPC, V, Name, InsertBefore);                    \\</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="preprocessor">  &#125;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="preprocessor">#include &quot;llvm/IR/Instruction.def&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="438"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This is the base class for all instructions that perform data</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="439"><Highlight kind="comment">/// casts. It is simply provided so that instruction category testing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="440"><Highlight kind="comment">/// can be performed with code like:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="441"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="442"><Highlight kind="comment">/// if (isa&lt;CastInst&gt;(Instr)) &#123; ... &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="443"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Base class of casting instructions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A no-op cast is one that can be effected without changing any bits.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It implies that the source and destination types are the same size. The</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is the same size as the pointer. However, pointer size varies with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// platform.  Note that a precondition of this method is that the cast is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// legal - i.e. the instruction formed with these operands would verify.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00665" /><CodeLine lineNumber="665"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This enumeration lists the possible predicates for CmpInst subclasses.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Values in the range 0-31 are reserved for FCmpInst, while values in the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00667" /><CodeLine lineNumber="667"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// range 32-64 are reserved for ICmpInst. This is necessary to ensure the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00668" /><CodeLine lineNumber="668"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// predicate values are not overlapping between the classes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00669" /><CodeLine lineNumber="669"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00670" /><CodeLine lineNumber="670"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Some passes (e.g. InstCombine) depend on the bit-wise characteristics of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00671" /><CodeLine lineNumber="671"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FCMP&#95;&#42; values. Changing the bit patterns requires a potential change to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00672" /><CodeLine lineNumber="672"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// those passes.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00673" /><CodeLine lineNumber="673" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78b">Predicate</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00674" /><CodeLine lineNumber="674"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Opcode            U L G E    Intuitive operation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00675" /><CodeLine lineNumber="675" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78bae9c013750fff3023001d7e3af8df2d6d"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78bae9c013750fff3023001d7e3af8df2d6d">FCMP&#95;FALSE</a> = 0, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; 0 0 0 0    Always false (always folded)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00676" /><CodeLine lineNumber="676" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba024db78a5ed74f64666f3ca4955e6eca"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cmpinst/#a2be3583dac92a031fa1458d4d992c78ba024db78a5ed74f64666f3ca4955e6eca">FCMP&#95;OEQ</a> = 1,   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">///&lt; 0 0 0 1    True if ordered and equal</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="comment">/// A container for an operand bundle being viewed as a set of values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="comment">/// rather than a set of uses.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Unlike OperandBundleUse, OperandBundleDefT owns the memory it carries, and</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Base class for all callable instructions (InvokeInst and CallInst)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Holds everything related to calling a function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><Highlight kind="comment">/// All call-like instructions are required to use a common operand layout:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Zero or more arguments to the call,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Zero or more operand bundles with zero or more operand inputs each</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><Highlight kind="comment">///   bundle,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - Zero or more subclass controlled operands</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><Highlight kind="comment">/// - The called function.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This allows this base class to easily access the called function and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><Highlight kind="comment">/// start of the arguments without knowing how many other operands a particular</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><Highlight kind="comment">/// subclass requires. Note that accessing the end of the argument list isn&#39;t</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><Highlight kind="comment">/// as cheap as most other operations on the base class.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a8a6c9c1339e7a196e0ae69031426c083">CallBase</a> : </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#ae70f02adcd410ca9c8429fa8d7711965">Instruction</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">protected</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The first two bits are reserved by CallInst for fast retrieval,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a2202e11d8597e6945b50553155da0f6c"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a2202e11d8597e6945b50553155da0f6c">CallInstReservedField</a> = <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bitfield/element">Bitfield::Element&lt;unsigned, 0, 2&gt;</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a20cd52815cac3179b0c156c0c1e32a1b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a20cd52815cac3179b0c156c0c1e32a1b">CallingConvField</a> =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><Highlight kind="normal">                        <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4ca2f101663d054cffa9c9956f30e7ecf7d">CallingConv::MaxID</a>&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;assert</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1120"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/bitfield/#a3a98703db928a3d2cb2dbc2868893f05">Bitfield::areContiguous&lt;CallInstReservedField, CallingConvField&gt;</a>(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1121"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Bitfields must be contiguous&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Create a clone of \\p CB with a different set of operand bundles and</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The returned call instruction is identical \\p CB in every way except that</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1638"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the data operand at index \\p i has the attribute \\p</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1639"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// A.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1640"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1641"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Data operands include call arguments and values used in operand bundles,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1642"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// but does not include the callee operand.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1643"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1644"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The index \\p i is interpreted as</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1645"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1646"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  \\p i in &#91;0, arg&#95;size)  -&gt; argument number (\\p i)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1647"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  \\p i in &#91;arg&#95;size, data&#95;operand&#95;size) -&gt; bundle operand at index</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1648"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     (\\p i) in the operand list.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1649" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a590b8b0d5d2ae53eeb6f290d7395c71c"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#a590b8b0d5d2ae53eeb6f290d7395c71c">dataOperandHasImpliedAttr</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/attribute/#aab7ee4b8fd1d3e7e4cea87868855e60e">Attribute::AttrKind</a> Kind)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1650"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Note that we have to add one because &#96;i&#96; isn&#39;t zero-indexed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1651"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(i &lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#adde2ea00dd2613ee41bfe91908e4e68e">arg&#95;size</a>() + <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase/#aff4a43d51265443e3d62d49395d0b585">getNumTotalBundleOperands</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2167"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2168"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return the start of the list of BundleOpInfo instances associated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2169"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// with this OperandBundleUser.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2170"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2171"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// OperandBundleUser uses the descriptor area co-allocated with the host User</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2172"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to store some meta information about which operands are &quot;normal&quot; operands,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2173"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and which ones belong to some operand bundle.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2174"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2175"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The layout of an operand bundle user is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2176"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2177"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          +-----------uint32&#95;t End-------------------------------------+</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2178"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          |                                                            |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2179"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          |  +--------uint32&#95;t Begin--------------------+              |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2180"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          |  |                                          |              |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2181"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///          ^  ^                                          v              v</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2182"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  |------|------|----|----|----|----|----|---------|----|---------|----|-----</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2183"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  | BOI0 | BOI1 | .. | DU | U0 | U1 | .. | BOI0&#95;U0 | .. | BOI1&#95;U0 | .. | Un</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2184"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  |------|------|----|----|----|----|----|---------|----|---------|----|-----</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2185"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   v  v                                  ^              ^</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2186"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   |  |                                  |              |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2187"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   |  +--------uint32&#95;t Begin------------+              |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2188"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   |                                                    |</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2189"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   +-----------uint32&#95;t End-----------------------------+</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2190"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2191"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2192"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BOI0, BOI1 ... are descriptions of operand bundles in this User&#39;s use</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2193"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// list. These descriptions are installed and managed by this class, and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2194"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// they&#39;re all instances of OperandBundleUser&lt;T&gt;::BundleOpInfo.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2195"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2196"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// DU is an additional descriptor installed by User&#39;s &#39;operator new&#39; to keep</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2197"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// track of the &#39;BOI0 ... BOIN&#39; co-allocation.  OperandBundleUser does not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2198"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// access or modify DU in any way, it&#39;s an implementation detail private to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2199"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// User.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2200"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2201"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The regular Use&amp; vector for the User starts at U0.  The operand bundle</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2202"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// uses are part of the Use&amp; vector, just like normal uses.  In the diagram</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2203"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// above, the operand bundle uses start at BOI0&#95;U0.  Each instance of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2204"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BundleOpInfo has information about a contiguous set of uses constituting</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2205"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// an operand bundle, and the total set of operand bundle uses themselves</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2206"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// form a contiguous set of uses (i.e. there are no gaps between uses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2207"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// corresponding to individual operand bundles).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2208"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2209"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This class does not know the location of the set of operand bundle uses</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2210"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// within the use list -- that is decided by the User using this class via</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2211"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the BeginIdx argument in populateBundleOperandInfos.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2212"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
